title: LC circuit - describe flow of charge

content.question: A circuit is constructed with a charged capacitor, a switch, and an inductor connected in series as shown. The switch in the circuit is closed at time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>. Which of the following graphs could represent the current <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math> in the circuit as a function of time?

choices.label: The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a plane with the origin labeled 0. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled I. The curve begins at the origin and moves upward and to the right, steeply at first and then more gradually.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a plane with the origin labeled 0. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled I. The curve begins on the vertical axis toward the top and moves downward and to the right, steeply at first and then more gradually.

The figure shows the graph of a sinusoidal wave in the first and fourth quadrants of a plane with the origin labeled 0. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled I. The wave begins at the origin, moves upward and to the right at first, goes through two and one quarter cycles with 3 peaks and 2 troughs, crosses the horizontal axis four times, and ends at a peak.

The figure shows the graph of a sinusoidal wave in the first and fourth quadrants of a plane with the origin labeled 0. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled I. The wave begins at a peak on the vertical axis above the origin, moves downward and to the right at first, goes through two cycles with 3 peaks and 2 troughs, crosses the horizontal axis four times, and ends at a peak.

content.answer: The figure shows the graph of a sinusoidal wave in the first and fourth quadrants of a plane with the origin labeled 0. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled I. The wave begins at the origin, moves upward and to the right at first, goes through two and one quarter cycles with 3 peaks and 2 troughs, crosses the horizontal axis four times, and ends at a peak.
